title: Online Assessment and Academic Integrity: Simulation-Based Reflective Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design and educational assessment principles, with online learning experience
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service and in-service teachers to explore strategies for maintaining academic integrity in online assessment design, combined with reflective practice through VR simulations of real-world scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three types of academic misconduct that may occur in online assessment environments.
Learners can design and evaluate strategies to promote academic integrity using simulation/VR tools.
Learners can analyze cases of ethical dilemmas experienced in online assessments through personal reflective journals and propose alternatives.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
